caseTitle: Syed Azhar Hussain Shah v. The State thr. P.G, Punjab and another
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Asif Saeed Khan Khosa
tagline: Section 34 of Cr.PC provides that the Court of a Magistrate specially empowered under section 30 of Cr.PC may pass any sentence authorized by the law except the sentence of death or imprisonment for a term exceeding seven years but that limitation on the sentence to be passed by a Magistrate only regulates the punishment and not the jurisdiction of the Magistrate to try an offence.
